reviewText: The original MIB is one of my favorite movies.  The BluRay transfer is great heare and is, alone, well worth the purchase.  The quality is the same for the other two entries in the box but 1 and 3 are the only ones I'd consider worthwile films.  All three are packaged in a very nice booklet similar to the original MIB collectors edition DVD.  The extras, to my knowledge, are the same that are included with the individual BluRay transfers.  The "bobble head" figure is a fantastic addition for those that are into displaying that kind of thing.  It's heavy, doesn't feel like it would break easily, and has great detail.
summary: Great figure but comes with MIB2 so it's a wash

reviewText: I had been eyeing this on Amazon for several weeks but worried my wife would not agree to putting out the money for this, and anyway she's not much of a Men in Black fan like I am.  I happened to be at a store a couple of days after MIB 3's release and saw this there too & happened to have credit at this place so I picked it up.  (Nothing personal Amazon...I do purchase plenty on here though).The collectible that comes in this collector's set is really rather cool...I set it on our TV stand right next to our TV, upon my wife's approval of course.  She may not be a big fan of Men In Black but she does like some of the aliens and stuff in it, LoL.The trilogy comes in a collectible case with a dust cover, and I think it's pretty cool.  I did see ads at some places that 3 was suppose to have a DVD copy but never found one in it.  However, I'm not going to rate the product lower because the product itself doesn't say there is a DVD copy...just some various sites got it wrong.As for the movies, 1 is and will always be my favorite...I remember watching that movie when it came out and I've loved it ever since.  After having watched 3, which I hadn't actually gotten a chance to see sadly until I bought this set, it officially became my 2nd favorite...I figured I'd like it after all the reviews I'd seen for it, and my dad & some friends told me it was pretty good, so I figured it was a safe bet.  2 is my 3rd favorite...good, but just not quite up to par with 3, and certainly not with 1.  Here is my individual ratings for each film:Men in Black 5/5Men in Black 2: 3.5/5Men in Black 3: 4.5/5So here's the scoop:  If you have never seen a single Men in Black film in your life, what's wrong with you?  If you have seen say 1 but not the others, I still recommend seeing them but 1 is the best, 3 is pretty good, and 2 is just good/not bad.  I for one really enjoy the whole series of movies, and this was certainly the perfect collector's set to add to my collection!

reviewText: I got this set today and was surprised by how light it was.  I thought there would be three Blu-Ray cases.  But, unfortunately the company that released them decided to have the type of set in which the discs just lay there on the sleeves.  They were all fine, but I took them out and put them in Blu-Ray cases so I could be sure they would not be damaged by the package.  The case that holds the discs is very solid and seems well built though.  The case is in a sleeve and you slide it from the top or bottom to get the case out and then the Blu-Rays are inside.  It looks very under cover and cool.  The figure seems very well made and will look very cool sitting in whatever place I decide to stick it.  Each blu ray is packed with special features.  Things like photo galleries, behind the scenes, blooper reel, games and commentary.  I always watch all the special features, so this is a great thing for me and those who do so as well.I easily downloaded the digital copy for each.  Well, I have had problems with actually getting the movies from Sony.  The Sony Media manager is not showing up on my Windows 8 PC.  But that has nothing to do with the movies, or the fact that they were easily put into my movies list on Ultraviolet.  I just have to figure out how to download them. All and all I think this is a very cool set that any fans of the movie should own.  I got it for less than $60 which is a great price.While I gave this set a 5 because of the great movies, the sturdy packing and all the great special features, I would give the way the Blu-Rays are in the case a 1.  Just put the discs in the standard cases.  They may cost more, but I would rather pay more and have safe discs than pay less and have to worry.
summary: A cool, sleek looking set for the little alien in all of us.

reviewText: This great sci-fi/comedy trilogy features Will Smith and Tommy Lee Jones in all three films. You get 3 movies on 3 discs along with UV digital copies: Men in Black, Men in Black 2, and Men in Black 3. A Limited Edition Worm Figurine is included. Overall, the picture and audio quality are very good (but a remastering wouldn't hurt on the first two films). There is over 3.5 hours of total bonus content plus 3 audio commentaries. The longest featurette is Partners in Time: The Making of 'MIB 3' (HD, 26 min). The 3D version of Men in Black 3 is not included (the 3D version also includes a couple more supplements). My only complaints are that I would have preferred a 3-hour retrospective documentary on the trilogy, the supplements on the original MiB could be beefed up, and MiB 2 weighs the trilogy down. Fans may want to purchase the films in their stand-alone Blu-rays for half the price since the worm figurine does not justify the price hike (although it is well made for a toy pack-in). These are 4 star films in a 3 star package.Video Resolution/Codec: 1080p/AVC MPEG-4 | Aspect Ratio: 1.85:1Audio Formats: English DolbyTrueHD 5.1, English DTS-HD Master Audio 5.1Subtitles/Captions: English, English SDH, French, SpanishSpecial Features:[Men in Black] 2 Audio Commentaries + 35 minutes of bonus content.[Men in Black 2] Audio Commentary + 105 minutes of bonus content.[Men in Black 3] 90 minutes of bonus content.
summary: Men in Black Trilogy Giftset on Blu-ray

reviewText: I just received this yesterday, and I must say it was unique. The MIBIII disc alone, at a local electronics store, was almost $30.00, and for about $10.00 more, you get all three movies, and this very nice, well made Worm Figurine. This thing weighs about two pounds. I have only watched the MIBIII disc, but I liked it very much. If you are a fan of the MIB movie series, then this is the one to get.

reviewText: My husband is a HUGE MIB fan, every since the first one came out. I got this for him as an anniversary present and he was beyond excited! He even took it to work to show it off. The worm guy bobble figure now sits on our Xbox tower next to our TV in the living room. We've been looking for a MIB set and this one was perfect! He loves it and so do I. The movies pay great, the collector box will look great if we decide to display it that way, and the bobble figure is a great addition for the avid MIB fan.

reviewText: Like many others I don't think Ultraviolet is a true digital copy. Getting these movies onto your computer is a giant, time-consuming hassle.It is much better to have a digital copy, come on a physical disk.I would have much preferred to buy this set that included Blu-ray, standard DVDs, and a digital copy on disk, and not received the toy!I like the movies themselves fine.This review is for the entire shopping experience and the physical item shipped by Amazon.  If you are after a "pure" movie review I recommend you also see the The Internet Movie Database.
